title: Sources: Harden to sign $81.5M deal with Clips
content: James Harden is declining his $36.3 million player option and intends to sign a two-year, $81.5 million contract to return to the Clippers, sources told ESPN.

title: Beasley subject of federal gambling investigation
content: Federal authorities are investigating Pistons guard Malik Beasley on allegations of gambling related to NBA games and prop bets, sources told ESPN.

title: LeBron opts in for $52.6M, watching L.A. moves
content: LeBron James is exercising his $52.6 million player option for the 2025-26 season, Klutch Sports CEO Rich Paul told ESPN. James intends to closely monitor the Lakers' moves and whether the team is positioning itself to field a title-contending roster.

title: Sources: Portis to sign $44M deal with Bucks
content: Bobby Portis intends to sign a three-year, $44 million contract to return to the Bucks, with a player option for 2027-28, sources told ESPN on Sunday.

title: Clark, Collier WNBA All-Star captains by fan vote
content: Caitlin Clark and Napheesa Collier will captain the WNBA All-Star Game next month, the league announced Sunday.

title: D. Wayne Lukas, Hall of Fame horse trainer, dies
content: D. Wayne Lukas, a Hall of Fame horse trainer who was second all time with 15 Triple Crown race wins, has died at the age of 89.

title: Harrington outlasts Cink to win U.S. Senior Open
content: Padraig Harrington came out on top of a major championship that felt more like match play, closing his round on Sunday with seven straight pars, for a 3-under 67, at the U.S. Senior Open, topping Stewart Cink by one shot in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

title: Source: Stars bringing back Gulutzan as coach
content: The Stars are bringing back Glen Gulutzan as their head coach 12 years after he was fired by the organization, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Detroit vs. Everybody: Are the Tigers the team to beat in MLB?
content: Detroit was the first team to win 50 games -- but do our experts actually pick the Tigers to win it all at the halfway mark?

title: Not even Messi can bridge gap between UCL champs PSG and MLS' Inter Miami
content: At times, Lionel Messi has singlehandedly carried Inter Miami to victory. Against the European champions PSG, the Herons needed more than that.

title: Experts weigh in: Can Alcaraz and Gauff win another major? What about Djokovic?
content: Just three weeks after the last Grand Slam, Wimbledon begins on Monday. Our experts answer these questions and more.

title: Is Jake Paul ready for a world title fight? Who is his best option?
content: Following his victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr., Jake Paul called out the cruiserweight champs. But can he get them in the ring?

title: Al Hilal keen to show their level vs. Man City at Club World Cup
content: Some call Al Hilal the 'Real Madrid of Saudi Arabia,' and they have a chance to prove why when they face Manchester City on Monday.

title: PSG rout ends CWC run for Inter Miami, Messi
content: Joao Neves scored twice as Paris Saint-Germain swept aside Lionel Messi's Inter Miami CF 4-0 at Atlanta's Mercedes-Benz Stadium on Sunday to secure their place in the Club World Cup quarterfinals with ruthless efficiency.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree $82M deal for João Pedro
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth a total of £60 million for Brighton striker Joao Pedro, sources have told ESPN.

title: Alba: Miami 'lived up to expectations' despite exit
content: Inter Miami CF left-back Jordi Alba said the team lived up to the expectations of the Club World Cup despite falling 4-0 to Paris Saint-Germain in the round of 16 to be eliminated from the competition.

title: England rout Jamaica 7-0 in Euro 2025 send-off
content: England eased past Jamaica 7-0 on Sunday to give themselves a winning send off as they head to Switzerland for Euro 2025 looking to defend their crown.

title: 'It's a joke': Maresca slams CWC weather delays
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca questioned the choice of the U.S. as host of the Club World Cup and branded the two-hour weather delay in his team's win over Benfica as "a joke."

title: Mexico into Gold Cup semis as Mora makes history
content: Alexis Vega scored the crucial opening goal early in the second half to help Mexico to a 2-0 win over Saudi Arabia in the Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Bonmati out of hospital; to rejoin Spain squad
content: Spain striker Aitana Bonmatí has been discharged from hospital after recovering from viral meningitis and will re-join the squad in the coming days.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree to sign Gittens; 7-yr deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth up to €65 million ($76.1m) to sign Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, sources have told ESPN.

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: Elliott uses last lap to post 'unbelievable' win
content: Home-state favorite Chase Elliott passed Brad Keselowski on the final lap and won the the crash-filled NASCAR Cup Series at Atlanta for his 20th career victory, saying afterward that "this is something I'll remember the rest of my life."

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt
content: What happens when hundreds of Ryans -- no Bryans allowed! -- descend on Coors Field in the hopes of making history? Delightful chaos.﻿

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Early 2026 NBA mock draft: Meet the four contenders for the No. 1 pick
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: Luis Enrique: PSG can't relax vs. best ever Messi
content: Paris Saint-Germain manager Luis Enrique warned his players against ignoring the offensive threats of Lionel Messi and Inter Miami in Sunday's Club World Cup match.

title: Klopp: Expanded Club World Cup the worst idea
content: Former Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp has criticised the introduction of the expanded Club World Cup format, calling it the worst idea ever implemented in football.

title: Poch hails 'great' Navas ahead of Gold Cup reunion
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino hailed Costa Rica goalkeeper Keylor Navas as "one of the best in the world" ahead of Sunday's Gold Cup quarterfinal.

title: Ronaldo: Saudi league already top 5 in the world
content: Cristiano Ronaldo preferred to take a rest rather than play in the revamped Club World Cup, he said on Saturday after renewing his contract with Al Nassr.

title: Schmelzel, Valenzuela team up to take Dow lead
content: Sarah Schmelzel and Albane Valenzuela took a one-shot lead Saturday in the Dow Championship after shooting a 2-under 68 in alternate-shot play.

title: No meat, eggs or school uniforms in State Gurukuls
content: Contractors and suppliers of these essentials are vexed as their payments are pending for several months

title: Golconda fort turns into sea of devotion, tradition for Bonalu
content: Bonams, or earthen pots containing cooked rice, jaggery, curd and other offerings balanced on the heads of women, formed a striking sight against the backdrop of the ancient fort

title: Pro-Schedule Castes organisations and activists allege foul play in death of man in Tiruppur district
content: He was found hanging from a tree with his hands tied near Dharapuram. The police suspect it to be a case of suicide, and the victim’s family also did not raise any suspicion over the death

title: 52 villages adjoining LAC, LoC in Leh, Kargil districts declared reserved areas
content: As per the notification, this declaration will enable residents of these identified areas to avail reservation benefits as specified in the amended Ladakh Reservation Rules

title: Inquiry into Puri Rath Yatra stampede to be completed in 30 days: Odisha Minister
content: Prithviraj Harichandan said that Development Commissioner Anu Garg will submit her inquiry report to the Chief Minister within the stipulated 30 days

title: People hit streets in Kolkata, add intensity to protests over law college gang rape
content: Medico-legal examination and recording of the statement by the survivor have been completed; Kolkata Police expand number of officers in the SIT formed to probe the crime

title: Security forces seize huge quantity of explosives in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharswan
content: The explosives, including 500 electronic detonators, were seized from a Maoist dump set up in Gobargota forest near Raijama village, a statement issued by Superintendent of Police Mukesh Kumar Lunayat said

title: Pakistan national apprehended along LoC in J&K
content: The Army officials are presently questioning the Pakistani national, identified as Mohammad Arib Ahmed, the son of Mohd Yousaf, a resident of Detote in Nikiyal Tehsil of Kotli district

title: Delhi-bound Air India flight from Tokyo's Haneda Airport diverted to Kolkata
content: "Air India flight AI357 operating from Haneda to Delhi on June 29 made a precautionary diversion to Kolkata due to persistent warm temperature experienced in the cabin," Air India said.

title: Congress targets Centre over Indian defence attache’s remarks on ‘loss of fighter jets’ during Operation Sindoor
content: Party leaders accuse Modi government of misleading people, question Prime Minister’s refusal to take Opposition into confidence

title: At Nitish’s turf, Chirag says Opposition leaders fear his arrival in Bihar
content: As long as ‘Chirag Paswan is alive’, there will be no threat to reservation, he says; LJP (RV) leader further takes dig at RJD, says they are allied with the party that imposed Emergency; promises he will have a ‘Bihar First-Bihari First’ policy

title: Reservation chart set to be prepared eight hours prior to departure of train
content: New PRS, which is being developed, will allow over 1.5 lakh ticket bookings per minute, says official

title: Remarks of Trinamool leaders on law college rape put party in a tight spot
content: The remarks by senior party MP Kalyan Banerjee and MLA Madan Mitra on the gang rape of a student at South Calcutta Law College has come as an embarrassment to the party

title: Airlines not reporting unruly behaviour of passengers, says DGCA
content: The aviation regulator reiterates the rule to submit to it a detailed report on such incidents within 24 hours of landing

title: AI will enable police to render quick services and check crime, says A.P. DGP
content: IPS officers, AI experts, startup companies, researchers and students discuss on tracking criminals, monitoring data, preventing cybercrimes, online frauds and detecting cases during the three-day ‘AI4AndhraPolice’ hackathon

title: DMK will secure majority, there will be no coalition government: Vaiko
content: Speaking to reporters in Chennai, he says the MDMK will work hard to ensure victory for the DMK and its alliance partners

title: Bihar voter list row: Why EC’s special revision is facing political heat - explained
content: The Election Commission's announcement of a special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar has ignited political controversy ahead of the upcoming assembly elections. The EC aims to remove illegal immigrants from voter lists, sparking opposition concerns about the timing and potential disenfranchisement of marginalized communities.

title: How Qatar thwarted Iran’s attack on US base; 300 troops scrambled – missiles lit up Doha sky
content: Qatar successfully intercepted Iranian missiles targeting Al Udeid Air Base, a key US military hub, averting a major catastrophe. The Qatari-led defense, coordinated with US forces, neutralized most of the missiles, resulting in minimal damage and no casualties. This attack followed US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, escalating tensions in the region despite a fragile ceasefire.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: Hindi 'imposition' row: Maha govt cancels 3-language policy resolution
content: The Maharashtra government has withdrawn its order implementing the three-language policy following opposition protests against the perceived imposition of Hindi. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced the decision and the formation of a committee, led by Dr. Narendra Jadhav, to review the language policy. The committee will submit its recommendations within three months.

title: Quad meeting 2025: Jaishankar to join talks in Washington from June 30 to July 2
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to visit the United States from June 30 to July 2, attending the Quad Foreign Ministers' Meeting in Washington, D.C. on July 1. Discussions will center on regional and global issues, particularly those concerning the Indo-Pacific, and progress on Quad projects will be reviewed.

title: Did Altman lie? Ex-OpenAI engineer joining Meta on $100M signing bonus
content: Lucas Beyer, a recent Meta hire from OpenAI, refuted claims of a $100 million signing bonus, dismissing them as "fake news." This follows Sam Altman's suggestion of Meta's extravagant offers to lure talent. Meta's CTO criticized Altman's tactics as dishonest, highlighting the ongoing talent war and Meta's significant AI investments.

title: IND vs ENG: Manjrekar warns KL Rahul - 'Can't be a one-hundred wonder'
content: Sanjay Manjrekar urges KL Rahul to display consistent Test performances as he steps into a senior role after Virat Kohli's and Rohit Sharma's retirements. While the former India star is confident of Rishabh Pant he wants KL Rahul to step up and maintain his form that he showed in the 1st Test.

title: Pragg breaks silence on Carlsen's table slam: 'Is it a good thing? Maybe not'
content: After Magnus Carlsen’s table-slam went viral following a loss to D Gukesh, R Praggnanandhaa called it an instinctive reaction — not ideal, but good for chess visibility. While praising Carlsen as the best, Praggnanandhaa reflected on his own breakthrough year, having won three major titles and rising to World No. 4 as he eyes a Candidates spot.

title: US govt message to Visa applicants: From July 1, immigration agency to no longer send...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: Tragedy! Cricketer dies of heart attack moments after hitting a six - Video
content: In a tragic incident in Firozpur, cricketer Harjeet Singh died on the field after hitting a six. He collapsed moments later, suffering a fatal heart attack. Despite immediate CPR efforts by teammates, he was declared dead at the scene. This incident follows a similar tragedy in Pune earlier this year, raising concerns about cardiac incidents among athletes.

title: Filmed private videos, body-shamed girls: How 'Mango's' campus abuse was ignored
content: Manojit Mishra, accused of gang-rape, was known at his Kolkata law college for alleged abuse of power and instilling fear, particularly among women. He reportedly recorded private moments, morphed pictures, and shared them in WhatsApp groups for ridicule.

title: Mitch Marner bids emotional farewell as Maple Leafs brace for bold new era
content: Mitch Marner’s heartfelt farewell to the Toronto Maple Leafs signals a major turning point for the franchise, with his emotional exit interview and past-tense reflections. As free agency inches closer, Marner’s silence on staying and the team’s vague stance on contract talks make one thing clear, Toronto is preparing to move forward without him. The quiet farewell feels less like rumor and more like an accepted reality, with both player and franchise ready for a split.

title: AC trouble: Air India Tokyo-Delhi flight safely diverts to Kolkata
content: On June 29, 2025, Air India flight AI357, en route from Tokyo Haneda to Delhi, made a precautionary diversion to Kolkata due to persistent air-conditioning issues causing uncomfortably warm cabin temperatures. The Boeing 787 landed safely in Kolkata, where passengers are receiving support and alternative arrangements are being made to fly them to Delhi. The aircraft is currently undergoing checks.

title: USA Cricket board faces ICC pressure amid looming suspension threat
content: Despite repeated warnings to fix governance issues, little or no progress has been made; Governing body expects USAC directors to resign ahead of annual conference or face sanctions

title: Taylor Swift’s dad seeks exit from Lively-Baldoni feud; Kelce stands by
content: Taylor Swift is dealing with a legal situation involving Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni. Her father, Scott Swift, is reportedly exploring options to protect her. Travis Kelce is providing support. Taylor and Travis were recently seen at Tight Ends University in Nashville. They appeared happy and danced together. Sources suggest their relationship is serious and heading towards long-term commitment.

title: ‘Lost to Marathi manoos’: Uddhav exults govt's rollback on 3-language policy
content: Uddhav Thackeray claimed victory after the Maharashtra government withdrew orders implementing the three-language policy in primary schools, which mandated Hindi. Thackeray accused the government of attempting to divide Marathi speakers and questioned the pressure to promote Hindi. Following strong resistance, the government cancelled the resolutions and formed a committee under Dr. Narendra Jadhav to review the language policy.

title: 'I did marry a farmer': Hailee Steinfeld wants to trade glam for a garden
content: Following their recent wedding and honeymoon, Hailee Steinfeld is expressing a desire for a simpler life. She dreams of living on a farm, growing vegetables, and raising chickens. This vision aligns with Josh Allen's upbringing on a 2,000-acre farm in California, potentially making their shared dream a reality despite their high-profile careers.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Not proactive' - Gill's captaincy lambasted by former England cricketer
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy is under scrutiny following India's dramatic Test defeat in Leeds, despite dominating earlier phases of the match. Critics like David Lloyd point to tactical inexperience, while Alastair Cook urges patience, drawing parallels with Ben Stokes' initial leadership challenges.

title: Dwyane Wade applauds Celtics: Simons trade fuels playoff hopes
content: Following Jayson Tatum's devastating Achilles injury, the Boston Celtics strategically acquired Anfernee Simons, a move praised by Dwyane Wade. This bold decision aims to maintain competitiveness while navigating luxury tax constraints. Simons' scoring ability is expected to fill the offensive void, allowing Boston to remain a playoff contender led by Jaylen Brown and Derrick White.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Doesn't get bigger than this!' - ABD questions Bumrah's workload plan
content: AB de Villiers has expressed his surprise at reports suggesting Jasprit Bumrah will be rested for some of the ongoing Test series against England. De Villiers questioned the decision, drawing parallels to how South Africa managed Dale Steyn's workload, prioritising his availability for crucial Test matches.

title: Top stocks to buy next week: Spotlight on the bulls; check recommendations
content: Stock market recommendations: Sudeep Shah of SBICAP Securities suggests Apollo Hospitals Enterprise and LT Foods as top stock picks, foreseeing a bullish trend in Nifty and Bank Nifty. Nifty's breakout from a 31-day consolidation phase targets 25800-26100, while Bank Nifty, hitting record highs, aims for 59000. Accumulation zones and stop-loss levels are provided for both stock recommendations.

title: Watch: Shocking! Carlos Sainz’s F1 car catches fire at Austrian GP
content: The Austrian Grand Prix faced a delayed start due to Carlos Sainz's car malfunction, leading to his eventual retirement. Lando Norris triumphed after a fierce battle with McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri, who finished second. A first-lap collision forced Max Verstappen's retirement, shaking up the championship standings, with Piastri now leading Norris.

title: Top 5: Aamir on 'Thugs' rejections; Medical cause likely in Shefali's death
content: Shefali Jariwala's sudden death is suspected to be from natural causes, according to preliminary reports. Aamir Khan disclosed that Deepika Padukone, Alia Bhatt, and Shraddha Kapoor declined roles in 'Thugs of Hindostan.' Varun Dhawan has appealed to media outlets for sensitive coverage of Shefali's passing. Raja Chaudhary revealed Shweta Tiwari's divorce condition: he must stay away from their daughter, Palak.

title: Viral video: 'I stay serious so that others can ...' - Gambhir on The Kapil Sharma Show
content: Gautam Gambhir, India's head coach, has finally revealed the reason behind his serious demeanour. On The Kapil Sharma Show, Gambhir explained that he remains serious so others can smile, emphasising his focus and commitment to results. He also addressed his on-field confrontations, stating they are always for the country, not himself.

title: Blake Lively stops Swift from cutting her off as Kelce backs Taylor quietly
content: Blake Lively is reportedly struggling to salvage her friendship with Taylor Swift amidst the fallout from her legal issues with Justin Baldoni. As Travis Kelce distances himself from Ryan Reynolds, Lively is allegedly making desperate attempts to reconcile with Swift, even enlisting mutual friends for assistance. However, Swift's inner circle seems to be siding with her, leaving Lively's efforts uncertain.

title: Rift in TMC: Kalyan Banerjee drags Moitra's personal life; takes 'honeymoon' jibe
content: Trinamool Congress MPs Kalyan Banerjee and Mahua Moitra are embroiled in another public dispute, this time over Banerjee's controversial remarks regarding the South Calcutta Law College rape case. Banerjee responded to Moitra's criticism by attacking her personal life, referencing her marriage and questioning her ethics.

title: 'GF hogi, wife hogi': Sanjana recalls first meeting; Bumrah reacts, 'What logic is that?'
content: Jasprit Bumrah and Sanjana Ganesan humorously recounted their initial encounter during the 2019 World Cup, where Sanjana mistakenly believed Bumrah was avoiding her due to a presumed girlfriend or wife. Bumrah clarified that his shy nature led to the initial awkwardness. Eventually, they connected, married in 2021, and welcomed their son in 2023.

title: MLC: Unmukt Chand is LAKR's lone bright spot, but will USA Cricket notice?
content: After struggling in the first two Major League Cricket (MLC) seasons, Unmukt Chand has finally found his feet in the US, where he moved to live his ultimate dream: “to play for the US national team.” The right-handed batter has scored 243 runs in seven innings and is sixth on the list of top run-getters in the ongoing MLC 2025.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce spark engagement buzz: $4M vintage ring teased
content: Jewelers are speculating about the engagement ring Travis Kelce might choose for Taylor Swift, estimating a cost between $500,000 to $4 million. Experts suggest the ring will be personally meaningful and stylish, potentially vintage-inspired. While the couple hasn't addressed engagement rumors, they are currently enjoying their relationship amidst Swift's legal drama and Kelce's upcoming NFL season.

title: Puri stampede: Two senior cops suspended, top officials transferred
content: A deadly stampede near the Gundicha Temple in Puri during the Rath Yatra festival resulted in three fatalities and over 50 injuries. The chaos, attributed to poor crowd management and unauthorized vehicles, drew sharp criticism and prompted a government investigation. Eyewitnesses reported confusion and inadequate response, while former CM Patnaik slammed the administration's incompetence following the tragedy.

title: 'It's up to them': Owaisi keen on joining Mahagathbandhan in Bihar; says NDA must go
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has expressed his eagerness to join the Mahagathbandhan alliance for the upcoming Bihar assembly elections, aiming to prevent the BJP-led NDA from retaining power. Despite past unsuccessful attempts, AIMIM is ready to contest in Seemanchal and other regions, urging the opposition to unite against the NDA.

title: Drama! FIDE slams Kramnik's defamation lawsuit: 'Brings a lot of harm to chess'
content: The International Chess Federation (FIDE) has intervened in the dispute between Vladimir Kramnik and David Navara. FIDE expresses concern over the impact of Kramnik's accusations. It supports Navara and asks Kramnik to withdraw his defamation lawsuit. Levon Aronian has also appealed to Kramnik for reconciliation. FIDE emphasizes fairness and unity within the chess community.

title: Railways' 3 big ticketing changes: Charting, Tatkal, reservations explained
content: Indian Railways is set to introduce significant changes to its passenger reservation system, aiming to enhance passenger comfort. Key improvements include preparing reservation charts eight hours in advance, implementing verified user-only Tatkal ticket bookings with OTP authentication by July 2025, and launching a new passenger reservation system by December 2025.

title: 'Found friends on foreign soil': Nostalgic reunion lights up Team India nets - Watch
content: During preparations for the second Test against England, the Indian cricket team enjoyed a heartwarming reunion at Edgbaston as familiar faces from home joined their net practice. Current and former teammates reminisced about their shared journey, strengthening bonds. Jasprit Bumrah's return to the nets raised hopes, while the team focused on improving lower-order batting.

title: PM Modi plays audio of Vajpayee, Desai to sharpen attack over Emergency
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his Mann ki Baat address, recalled the Emergency imposed 50 years ago, terming it a dark chapter for Indian democracy. He stated that those who imposed it suppressed the judiciary and murdered the Constitution's spirit. Modi emphasized remembering those who fought against the Emergency to safeguard the Constitution.

title: IND v ENG: 'Bowling has to be ...' - Azhar urges India to reduce Bumrah dependency
content: Mohammad Azharuddin has cautioned India against over-relying on Jasprit Bumrah and suggested including Kuldeep Yadav for the second Test against England. He emphasised the need for a more varied bowling attack to support Bumrah. Azharuddin defended Shubman Gill's captaincy, urging patience and support for the new captain despite the team's batting collapse and defeat in the first Test.

title: Starlink launch: Spacex launches 27 satellites after storm delays
content: Despite severe weather warnings, SpaceX successfully launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying 27 Starlink satellites from Cape Canaveral. The launch coincided with the 10th anniversary of a Falcon 9 explosion, highlighting SpaceX's progress. The mission featured a reusable booster flying its fifth mission, landing successfully on the drone ship, demonstrating SpaceX's commitment to sustainable space travel.

title: What's ahead in 2025 for Notre Dame, UConn and the Pac-2?
content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal enter race to sign Ekitike
content: Arsenal have Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike in their sights. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Liverpool turn to Hato
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: How Wiegman's 'new England' have evolved ahead of Euro 2025
content: England won Euro 2022 but have undergone some changes in the three years since. How are they looking ahead of their title defense?

title: State check: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 1 quiz
content: How well do you know your state sports trivia? From D.C. to Alabama, we're putting your knowledge to the test.

title: Rewari village shuns family of Indian Navy staffer arrested for alleged spying
content: A decision was taken at a meeting to ostracise the family for ‘bringing a bad name to the village’, Sarpanch Satyalpal Yadav of Punsika village in Haryana told media persons

title: Kerala to seek sterilisation of Bonnet macaque near forests
content: The Kerala Forest Department had drawn up a ‘Mission Bonnet macaque’ as part of a 10-point programme to reduce instances of human-wildlife conflicts

title: Turmeric Board will strengthen farmers financially with new markets opening: Amit Shah
content: Farmers will no longer have to rely on middlemen as the Board will establish the entire value chain — packaging, branding, marketing and export, the Home Minister said

title: ACB suspects ‘clandestine code system’ by mediators at RTA office
content: The officials stumbled upon some markings on the applications which on investigation were found to be a code to identify the agent sending the application

title: Munnar church takes Hindi route as migrant workers flock to Mass
content: Hindi Mass to be held on the last Sunday of every month at Mount Carmel Basilica. Increasing number of Hindi-speaking migrant workers in plantation sector leads to decision. Through a Mass in their own language, we hope the faithful can fulfil their spiritual needs, says Church

title: Adarsh Saji elected SFI president, Srijan Bhattacharya is general secretary
content: The Students Federation of India also elected an 87-member central executive committee during its ongoing four-day national conference

title: Kerala Cabinet to decide on new State Police Chief on Monday
content: The race for the top position is reportedly tipped in favour of Ravada A. Chandrasekhar. Nitin Agrawal and Yogesh Gupta too on the list recommended by the UPSC

title: CHOs continue to wait for government response on resolution of demands
content: Stopping work, the CHOs had launched a Statewide protest on April 24 that continued for around 40 days

title: Kerala govt. firm on Zumba in schools, seeks an end to controversy
content: Several Muslim organisations seek to moderate the controversy in larger civic interest. SNDP Yogam backs government, BJP questions the wisdom of introducing the dance form in schools. Sivankutty says students are free to choose not to attend Zumba classes.  Youth Congress, SFI, and DYFI denounce move to impose religious considerations on sports and art forms

title: Speculation on leadership change in Karnataka surfaces again
content: While Ramanagara MLA predicts DKS may become CM in next two to three months, Minister H.C. Mahadevappa says Siddaramaiah will complete full term

title: Farmers in Kandukur intensify protest against Andhra Pradesh government’s plan to acquire 8,300 acres for solar project
content: Kandukur Sub-Collector visits the spot and promises to submit a report to the government on the ground situation

title: RLD pushes for Brahmin welfare board in Uttar Pradesh
content: “There is a pressing need for targeted support to economically weaker sections within the Brahmin community”, told RLD National Secretary Anupam Mishra, to The Hindu.

title: Stray dogs under observation for rabies at ABC centre
content: They are suspected to have been bitten by another stray dog that died recently and was later found to have had rabies

title: Authorities work to contain jaundice outbreak at a locality in Agartala
content: 52 persons in the Master Para locality of Agartala have been diagnosed as having jaundice; the Chief Medical Officer has directed govt. departments to contain the outbreak

title: KSRTC electric buses proposed inside Puthur Zoological Park
content: Feasibility study conducted for KSRTC electric buses at Puthur Zoological Park to enhance visitor transport convenience.

title: Former YSRCP MLA forced to leave Tadipatri as clashes erupt
content: Anarchy is prevailing in Tadipatri, alleges Pedda Reddy adding that he will move the High Court again on the issue

title: Residents of Holiday Village Road pray for divine intervention to fix deteriorated road
content: Frustrated by crumbling infrastructure and repeated inaction by authorities, residents performed a  pooja as a mark of their protest

title: Prepare for 2029 poll win, forestall YSRCP ‘misinformation campaign’, Naidu tells TDP leaders
content: Each one of us should reach out to every household and explain what the NDA government did in the last one year in order to win their confidence, says TDP chief, while cautioning the leaders that their performance is being closely monitored

title: Old warrants, new arrests
content: More than a decade after tribal communities in Odisha’s Narayanpatna block launched a movement against liquor vendors from outside their community which led to a struggle to reclaim their lost land, arrest warrants are now being effected against them. Prompted by a court order and executed by the police, people say they are being ‘punished’ for a mass uprising while the police claim people have Naxal links under the Chasi Mulia Adivasi Sangha, reports Satyasundar Barik

title: 162 students trapped in inundated residential school in Jharkhand after heavy rain rescued
content: As the single-storey school building was submerged, teachers shifted the students to the rooftop, where they spent the night. On information, the police rescued them on the morning of June 29, 2025. An orange alert has been issued for multiple regions for June 30 and July 1

title: Eshwarappa says talks ongoing within BJP on bringing him back to the party fold
content: I stand for Hindutva. I will remain committed to it. I will never leave the BJP, asserts the former Deputy Chief Minister

title: Where myth and nature come alive on canvas
content: Known for his delicate lines and stylised figures, Karunakaran’s work stands out for its distinctive portrayal of the female form

title: Will reach out to Centre seeking protection of Kakinada wetlands: BJP leader
content: Public representatives are being consulted for the protection of the wetlands; For Kakinada Smart City, Chollangi wetland is what wetlands in Navi Mumbai are for Mumbai city for coastal security, says BJP Former Kakinada District President Ch. Ram Kumar.

title: "Break Their Legs": Odisha Police Officer's Instruction At Protest Goes Viral. "Out Of Context," He Says
content: A senior police officer's very specific instruction to police personnel guarding a barbed wire barricade outside Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi's house during a protest by Congress party workers has gone viral on social media.

title: Indian Youth Congress Lodges Complaint Against RSS Leader's Preamble Remarks
content: Karnataka Unit of the Indian Youth Congress (IYC) Legal Cell lodged a formal complaint against RSS General Secretary Hosabale for calling for a reconsideration of the inclusion of terms "socialist" and "secular" in he Preamble of Indian Constitution.

title: Intercepted Iranian Communications Downplay Damage From US Strikes: Report
content: Intercepted Iranian communications downplayed the extent of damage caused by U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear program, the Washington Post reported on Sunday, citing four people familiar with classified intelligence circulating within the US government

title: "Like Absolute Butter": Trump On How US Struck Iran's Fordow Nuclear Site
content: Bombs dropped by American B-2 Stealth Fighter aircraft went through Iran's heavily-guarded Fordow nuclear facility "like butter", US President Donald Trump said.

title: 'Family Doctor' Tracks Shubhanshu Shukla's Health In Space: European Flight Surgeon
content: European Space Agency's seasoned flight surgeon Dr Brigitte Godard assured that Shubhanshu Shukla is medically fit for space with dedicated medical oversight.

title: Hyderabad-Bound IndiGo Flight Diverted To Vijayawada Due To Heavy Air Traffic: Report
content: An IndiGo flight from Pune to Hyderabad was diverted to Vijayawada on Sunday due to heavy air traffic in Hyderabad airspace, according to sources.

title: Alcohol Addict Kills Daughter, 4, For Demanding Money To Buy Chocolate In Maharashtra: Cops
content: A man addicted to alcohol allegedly strangled his four-year-old daughter to death on Sunday after she demanded money to buy chocolate in Latur district of Maharashtra, police said.

title: Chhattisgarh Congress Chief's Phone Stolen During Students' Union Meet
content: The incident took place at Rajiv Bhavan, the state Congress office, while Baij was leading a strategy session with NSUI office bearers.

title: Artisans Hit By Dilli Haat Fire To Get Rs 5 Lakh Each, Free Stalls For 6 Months
content: Delhi Tourism Minister Kapil Mishra today announced a relief and rehabilitation package for the artisans impacted by the recent fire at Dilli Haat INA.

title: 7 Arrested For Carrying Banned Electronic Walkie-Talkie Sets On India-Nepal Border
content: The Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) has arrested seven people with five banned frequency hopping enabled electronic walkie-talkie sets at Rupaidiha on the India-Nepal border in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district, an official on Sunday said.

title: Chandrashekhar Azad Stopped From Visiting UP Village, Supporters Clash With Cops
content: Police stopped Chandrashekhar Azad, the MP from Nagina, from going to Isota village to meet the family of a person who died of burn injuries, following which his angry supporters vandalised two police vehicles on Sunday, official sources said.

title: Fighter Jets To Soon Be Able To Land On Assam Highways During Emergency: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said that the government has planned to make provisions for emergency landing of Indian Air Force fighter jets as well as civilian aircraft.

title: Father Stabs Son, 10, To Death After Fight Over Playing In Rain In Delhi: Cops
content: A 10-year-old boy was allegedly stabbed to death by his father on Sunday afternoon following a dispute over playing in the rain in Sagarpur area of southwest Delhi, police said.

title: Puri Stampede: Odisha Chief Minister Orders Administrative Overhaul
content: Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi on Sunday ordered a major administrative shake-up following the stampede near Shree Gundicha Temple in Puri which claimed three lives and left around 50 people injured.

title: Woman's Body Stuffed Into Sack, Dumped In Garbage Truck In Bengaluru
content: The body of a woman, estimated to be in the 30-35 years age group, was stuffed into a sack and dumped in a garbage truck in Bengaluru.

title: Honeymoon Murder Case: Couple's Jewellery Recovered From Madhya Pradesh
content: The jewellery that Indore couple Raja Raghuvanshi and his wife Sonam took to their honeymoon in Meghalaya have been recovered by the police from Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam.

title: "Warm Temperature" In Cabin, Air India Tokyo-Delhi Flight Diverted To Kolkata
content: An Air India flight on Sunday was diverted to Kolkata due to "persistent warm temperature experienced in the cabin", said the airline.

title: Peace, Government Formation Discussed At BJP Manipur MLAs' Meet
content: Former Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh on Sunday said BJP legislators held talks focused on restoring peace and forming a popular government in the state.

title: Maharashtra Cancels 3-Language Policy Resolution Amid Hindi Imposition Charge
content: The Maharashtra government has cancelled a resolution on the three language policy for schools, with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announcing a panel to discuss the way ahead.

title: "Unjust, Irrational": AAP MP Amid Row Over Diljit Dosanjh's Sardaar Ji 3
content: An Aam Aadmi Party MP has come out in support of Punjabi actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh amid the ongoing controversy over his film Sardaar Ji 3, featuring Pakistani actress Hania Aamir.

title: Who's next for Ilia Topuria, Charles Oliveira, Alexandre Pantoja after UFC 317?
content: former featherweight champion Ilia Topuria knocked out former lightweight champion Charles Oliveira in the UFC 317 title fight . the men's flyweight division took center stage as topuria picked up knockout wins over Alexander Volkanovski and Max Holloway .

title: Austria could be a turning point for Norris' F1 title charge
content: a 1-2 finish at the Austrian Grand Prix with Lando Norris finishing first and Oscar Piastri in second . the victory provided a succinct answer to his critics . norris has shifted a title narrative that appeared ready to write him off following his disastrous Canadian Grand Prix .

title: From the favorites to the underdogs: Ranking the contenders
content: in the past 20 years, only 12 players have reached the gentlemen's final . Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic accounted for more than half of those 40 spots . despite a pretty clear hierarchy forming atop the women's tour, things are far different .

title: After a tough French Open, Naomi Osaka is optimistic about Wimbledon
content: Naomi Osaka lost first set to Paula Badosa at the french open last month . the 27-year-old struggled to speak in her news conference soon after . she apologized for cursing before sitting back in her chair .

title: How all 30 NBA teams ace their offseason
content: the free agency officially begins Monday at 6 p.m. ET . which teams will make the biggest splashes? will the los Angeles Lakers finally get a rim-running center to pair with Luka Doncic and LeBron James .

title: Grading all 32 NHL draft classes: From one A+ to multiple D's
content: a team with three first-round picks might have a lower grade . the grade is weighted against the expectation of what teams could reasonably have done with their selections based on my model and team need . every team is getting a draft grade, regardless of how many players they selected .

title: Breaking down LeBron's $52.6M option and the biggest moves this summer
content: the lakers are making moves to fill their rosters for the 2025-26 season . the move comes after a strong season as the backup center for the Western Conference's no. 2 seed . we're grading the moves and examining what each means for the season and beyond .

title: 👀 Cap room, best free agents for every NBA team
content: teams across the league are shifting focus to the free agency and trade landscape . how many teams have salary cap space, and which could create some? who could follow the Boston Celtics and make cost-cutting trades to save on their luxury tax bill?

title: List of all 224 picks, plus scouting notes for every first-rounder
content: the 2025 NHL draft is taking place on friday (Round 1) and Saturday (2rounds 2-7) at the Peacock Theater in los Angeles . each pick is added below, including scouting notes and team fit analysis for the first-rounders .
